Description: Fragment of weft-faced, plain weave textile with tapestry (single warp threads) bands; Thick cloth mainly in dark blue and undyed/yellow wool with parts of two tapestry bands in lighter blue wool and bleached linen; Design of a repeating row of flower heads or buds heavily outlined in blue; Between the tapestry bands is a plain undyed wool band and at the bottom of the lower tapestry band is a more complete band of plain dark blue; Warp: S spun undyed wool, c.12tpc; Weft: S spun undyed wool & linen, c.40tpc, S spun dark blue wool, c.60tpc; Edges: cut or ragged
Curator's comments: Unreg 49; Found 1988? in a packet in the Keeper's Office; Previous location cupboard O; Style similar to c.7th century fragments from 'En-Boqeq in Israel (Textile History 22, 1991); Edges cut post excavation; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (2.4.1991)
